<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/doj-arrests-couple-crypto-money-laundering-scheme?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Bitcoin Bonnie and Crypto Clyde
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/doj-arrests-couple-crypto-money-laundering-scheme?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Heather Morgan dances in front of a plane." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-02-08/image-f7f6b98f11764edc1801e30ea5962ba376aa89bb-480x270-gif/giphy-2.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Heather Morgan dances in front of a plane." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-02-08/image-f7f6b98f11764edc1801e30ea5962ba376aa89bb-480x270-gif/giphy-2.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Razzlekhan/YouTube</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s only February and we already have 2022’s “story most likely to be made into competing original films on Apple TV and Hulu.” On Tuesday, authorities <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/02/08/bitfinex-hack-bitcoin-arrests/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrested</a> a husband and wife (that’s her above) accused of attempting to launder 119,754 stolen bitcoin—valued at $4.5 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with the arrest of the couple, Ilya Lichtenstein and Heather Morgan, the Justice Department announced that it had seized more than 94,000 of the allegedly stolen bitcoin, valued at $3.6 billion—the largest financial seizure in the agency’s history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The bitcoin in question is connected to a 2016 hack of the crypto exchange Bitfinex, in which hackers exploited a security flaw and made over 2,000 unauthorized transactions—allegedly funneling stolen crypto into a wallet controlled by Lichtenstein. At the time of the hack, the stolen crypto was valued at $71 million—showing just how much the cryptocurrency has ballooned in price.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the DOJ, over the ensuing five years Lichtenstein and Morgan conspired to launder that stolen bitcoin through a complex process that involved depositing the funds into various currency exchanges and darknet markets using fictitious identities, and then withdrawing some as cash from Bitcoin ATMs, and spending some on NFTs, gold, and Walmart gift cards. The DOJ says the couple deposited some of the funds into their own accounts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But this isn’t just a story about money laundering. This is a story about <em>millennial </em>money laundering.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Crime is just the side hustle</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lichtenstein, 34, and Morgan, 31, aren’t your typical married couple accused of laundering stolen crypto. Both are incredibly, almost unbelievably, online. A Twitter account with Lichtenstein’s name posts frequently about Web3 and crypto.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And like so many born in the late ’80s, Morgan has a <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCU6zQo1qSp2EeJ0uiaSPHYA?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube channel</a> featuring some of the worst rapping of all time—under the pseudonym “Razzlekhan”—where she refers to herself as the “crocodile of Wall Street.” She’s also a former Forbes contributor: She penned a June 2020 article about how businesses can protect themselves from cybercriminals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pair faces up to 20 years in prison for the money laundering charges.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/08/peloton-makes-big-changes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Tour de headlines
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/08/peloton-makes-big-changes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Peloton bike" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/520ba0a906cbca94bef01708f22a78cd991c8c03-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Ezra Shaw/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/bicyclist_1f6b4.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">Peloton made big changes. </strong>As takeover rumors swirl, Peloton’s co-founder and CEO John Foley is stepping “down” to the position of executive chairman, while Netflix and Spotify vet Barry McCarthy will <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/08/business/peloton-layoffs-new-ceo/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take his place</a>. It’s also pulling the plug on its Ohio factory and axing 2,800 jobs to cut costs. As a parting gift, those laid-off employees will get severance payments, benefits, and, most generously, a free Peloton membership for a year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/popcorn_1f37f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">The Oscar noms are out. </strong><em>The Power of the Dog</em>, a Western,<em> </em><a href="https://apnews.com/article/oscar-nominations-academy-awards-6072fc4d4f4c03842a1d1df5d47984b4?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">led the pack</a> with 12 nominations, followed by <em>Dune</em>, a movie about worms,<em> </em>with 10. What else you should know: Beyoncé scored her first Oscar nod, Lin-Manuel Miranda could join the exclusive EGOT club, actor Troy Kotsur was the first deaf man nominated for an acting Oscar, and Steven Spielberg became the first filmmaker to be nominated for Best Director in six different decades.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/credit-card_1f4b3.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">Apple announces Tap to Pay. </strong>In a bid to encourage more smartphone intimacy, the company is releasing a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/08/apple-announces-tap-to-pay-on-iphone.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">feature</a> that allows customers to spend money by simply tapping an iPhone against a merchant’s iPhone—effectively turning the device into a checkout register. Apple’s Tap to Pay is expected to rival the point-of-sale system sold by Block (formerly known as Square).—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/08/canadian-protesters-temporarily-block-bridge-connecting-us-and-canada?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Vital trade routes pressured by Canadian protesters
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/08/canadian-protesters-temporarily-block-bridge-connecting-us-and-canada?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Supporters of the Truckers Convoy against the Covid-19 vaccine mandate block traffic in the Canada bound lanes of the Ambassador Bridge border crossing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9f1b8dd65148cf7bb3570696f03e5d7293a7c16c-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>GEOFF ROBINS/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Ambassador Bridge that links Detroit, Michigan, and Windsor, Ontario, carries more than 40,000 people and $323 million worth of goods each day. Accounting for roughly 25% of all US—Canada trade, it is “one of the most important border crossings in the world,” according to Canada’s public safety minister.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But from Monday night into Tuesday, traffic on the bridge was <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-ottawa-truckers-canada-protest-c49a25da25cd2f5e81f1eac5664e37ad?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disrupted</a> by Canadian truckers protesting Covid restrictions. And it’s raising alarms that the demonstrations that have paralyzed downtown Ottawa over the past two weeks could escalate to threaten trade and the broader economy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Even before Monday, protesters had blocked trade routes at various points along the US–Canada border.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Canadians have the right to protest, to disagree with their government. … But let’s be clear: They don’t have the right to blockade our economy or our democracy,” Prime Minister Justin Trudeau tweeted Tuesday.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Up to 500 trucks remained parked in downtown Ottawa, obstructing daily life and forcing city officials to declare a state of emergency. The protesters have said they won’t leave until Trudeau lifts Covid restrictions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now their cause is spreading, inspiring copycat protests in Canadian cities such as Toronto and Vancouver as well as in Australia and New Zealand, where demonstrators blocked streets in the capital city of Wellington on Tuesday.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/florida-home-for-sale-as-NFT?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Picture of NFT home on a sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/48547c70618e0dfe98e44a17488786dbe935e447-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Photo Illustration: Francis Scialabba; Source: Heckler Realty</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not just JPEGs of apes being sold as digital tokens. A house in Gulfport, FL, will be auctioned off as an NFT tomorrow in what is claimed to be the first US real estate NFT transaction. Bidding starts at $650,000 in ether.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Real estate tech company Propy is <a href="https://www.tampabay.com/news/real-estate/2022/02/04/this-tampa-bay-home-is-being-sold-as-an-nft/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handling the sale</a>, which would be its second NFT real estate transaction. Last year, Propy sold an apartment owned by TechCrunch founder Michael Arrington in Kiev, Ukraine, as an NFT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong>The NFT will effectively replace the house’s deed by representing a limited liability corporation that owns the property rights. So, (stay with us) the winning bidder will receive <em>an NFT of a company that owns the house</em>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s the point?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The home’s current owner Leslie Alessandra—who’s the founder of a decentralized finance company—said selling real estate NFTs could make the process of property buying as speedy as sending a Venmo by replacing the drawn out, Hogwarts letter-level of paperwork it currently is.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Regarding NFTs, she said, “Is this just hype or is there a real world application? [The auction] is really to stimulate conversation.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But a conversation has two sides: </strong>Critics say crypto’s infamous volatility and traditional real estate law could prove to be insurmountable hurdles for NFT-linked real estate to overcome.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

launder 119,754 stolen bitcoin—valued at $4.5 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlong with the arrest of the couple, Ilya Lichtenstein and Heather Morgan, the Justice Department announced that it had seized more than 94,000 of the allegedly stolen bitcoin, valued at $3.6 billion—the largest financial seizure in the agency’s history.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe bitcoin in question is connected to a 2016 hack of the crypto exchange Bitfinex, in which hackers exploited a security flaw and made over 2,000 unauthorized transactions—allegedly funneling stolen crypto into a wallet controlled by Lichtenstein. At the time of the hack, the stolen crypto was valued at $71 million—showing just how much the cryptocurrency has ballooned in price.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the DOJ, over the ensuing five years Lichtenstein and Morgan conspired to launder that stolen bitcoin through a complex process that involved depositing the funds into various currency exchanges and darknet markets using fictitious identities, and then withdrawing some as cash from Bitcoin ATMs, and spending some on NFTs, gold, and Walmart gift cards. The DOJ says the couple deposited some of the funds into their own accounts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut this isn’t just a story about money laundering. This is a story about \u003cem\u003emillennial \u003c/em\u003emoney laundering.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCrime is just the side hustle\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLichtenstein, 34, and Morgan, 31, aren’t your typical married couple accused of laundering stolen crypto. Both are incredibly, almost unbelievably, online. A Twitter account with Lichtenstein’s name posts frequently about Web3 and crypto.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd like so many born in the late ’80s, Morgan has a \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCU6zQo1qSp2EeJ0uiaSPHYA?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eYouTube channel\u003c/a\u003e featuring some of the worst rapping of all time—under the pseudonym “Razzlekhan”—where she refers to herself as the “crocodile of Wall Street.” She’s also a former Forbes contributor: She penned a June 2020 article about how businesses can protect themselves from cybercriminals.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pair faces up to 20 years in prison for the money laundering charges.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePeloton made big changes. \u003c/strong\u003eAs takeover rumors swirl, Peloton’s co-founder and CEO John Foley is stepping “down” to the position of executive chairman, while Netflix and Spotify vet Barry McCarthy will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/08/business/peloton-layoffs-new-ceo/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake his place\u003c/a\u003e. It’s also pulling the plug on its Ohio factory and axing 2,800 jobs to cut costs. As a parting gift, those laid-off employees will get severance payments, benefits, and, most generously, a free Peloton membership for a year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/popcorn_1f37f.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Oscar noms are out. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Power of the Dog\u003c/em\u003e, a Western,\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/oscar-nominations-academy-awards-6072fc4d4f4c03842a1d1df5d47984b4?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eled the pack\u003c/a\u003e with 12 nominations, followed by \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e, a movie about worms,\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003ewith 10. What else you should know: Beyoncé scored her first Oscar nod, Lin-Manuel Miranda could join the exclusive EGOT club, actor Troy Kotsur was the first deaf man nominated for an acting Oscar, and Steven Spielberg became the first filmmaker to be nominated for Best Director in six different decades.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/credit-card_1f4b3.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple announces Tap to Pay. \u003c/strong\u003eIn a bid to encourage more smartphone intimacy, the company is releasing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/08/apple-announces-tap-to-pay-on-iphone.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efeature\u003c/a\u003e that allows customers to spend money by simply tapping an iPhone against a merchant’s iPhone—effectively turning the device into a checkout register. Apple’s Tap to Pay is expected to rival the point-of-sale system sold by Block (formerly known as Square).—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Supporters of the Truckers Convoy against the Covid-19 vaccine mandate block traffic in the Canada bound lanes of the Ambassador Bridge border crossing\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9f1b8dd65148cf7bb3570696f03e5d7293a7c16c-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGEOFF ROBINS/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Ambassador Bridge that links Detroit, Michigan, and Windsor, Ontario, carries more than 40,000 people and $323 million worth of goods each day. Accounting for roughly 25% of all US—Canada trade, it is “one of the most important border crossings in the world,” according to Canada’s public safety minister.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut from Monday night into Tuesday, traffic on the bridge was \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-ottawa-truckers-canada-protest-c49a25da25cd2f5e81f1eac5664e37ad?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisrupted\u003c/a\u003e by Canadian truckers protesting Covid restrictions. And it’s raising alarms that the demonstrations that have paralyzed downtown Ottawa over the past two weeks could escalate to threaten trade and the broader economy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEven before Monday, protesters had blocked trade routes at various points along the US–Canada border.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Canadians have the right to protest, to disagree with their government. … But let’s be clear: They don’t have the right to blockade our economy or our democracy,” Prime Minister Justin Trudeau tweeted Tuesday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUp to 500 trucks remained parked in downtown Ottawa, obstructing daily life and forcing city officials to declare a state of emergency. The protesters have said they won’t leave until Trudeau lifts Covid restrictions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow their cause is spreading, inspiring copycat protests in Canadian cities such as Toronto and Vancouver as well as in Australia and New Zealand, where demonstrators blocked streets in the capital city of Wellington on Tuesday.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not just JPEGs of apes being sold as digital tokens. A house in Gulfport, FL, will be auctioned off as an NFT tomorrow in what is claimed to be the first US real estate NFT transaction. Bidding starts at $650,000 in ether.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReal estate tech company Propy is \u003ca href=\"https://www.tampabay.com/news/real-estate/2022/02/04/this-tampa-bay-home-is-being-sold-as-an-nft/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehandling the sale\u003c/a\u003e, which would be its second NFT real estate transaction. Last year, Propy sold an apartment owned by TechCrunch founder Michael Arrington in Kiev, Ukraine, as an NFT.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NFT will effectively replace the house’s deed by representing a limited liability corporation that owns the property rights. So, (stay with us) the winning bidder will receive \u003cem\u003ean NFT of a company that owns the house\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s the point?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe home’s current owner Leslie Alessandra—who’s the founder of a decentralized finance company—said selling real estate NFTs could make the process of property buying as speedy as sending a Venmo by replacing the drawn out, Hogwarts letter-level of paperwork it currently is.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRegarding NFTs, she said, “Is this just hype or is there a real world application? [The auction] is really to stimulate conversation.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut a conversation has two sides: \u003c/strong\u003eCritics say crypto’s infamous volatility and traditional real estate law could prove to be insurmountable hurdles for NFT-linked real estate to
